meanings.definition: The recording of events in order of time.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy reading the chronography of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: The textbook provided a detailed chronography of World War II.
meanings.sent3: The chronography of my daily routine would be quite boring to read.
meanings.sent4: Her journal served as a personal chronography of her thoughts and experiences.
meanings.sent5: The chronography of the marathon race was meticulously documented by the organizers.

meanings.definition: A historical account arranged in chronological order.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a fascinating chronography of the city's development.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a detailed chronography of the royal family's lineage.
meanings.sent3: The chronography of the family reunion read like a dramatic novel.
meanings.sent4: His collection of old letters formed a unique chronography of the past.
meanings.sent5: The chronography of the explorer's journey was filled with exciting discoveries.
